snippet: Lackluster jobs data and economic storm clouds have not convinced Federal Reserve officials that growth is slowing or that they should respond, the Fed’s chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, said on Thursday.
abstract: Federal Reserve chairman Ben S Bernanke says lackluster jobs data and economic storm clouds have not convinced Fed officials that growth is slowing or that they should respond; says officials are updating their economic forecasts ahead of their upcoming meeting.
lead_paragraph: Lackluster jobs data and economic storm clouds have not convinced Federal Reserve officials that growth is slowing or that they should respond, the Fed’s chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, said on Thursday.

headline.seo: Bernanke Offers No Clear Sign of New Action
headline.main: Bernanke Offers No Clear Sign of New Action
headline.print_headline: Grappling Globally With the Economy: Bernanke Offers No Clear Sign Of New Action
